title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
lucaa left #xwiki at 00:06  
CalebJamesDeLisl joined #xwiki at 09:03  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:09): Hello  
xwiki-bridge - (10:10): [Vincent Massol] Hi Caleb  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:10): Hey, I was wondering if it would be a big deal to require programming rights for users to edit syntax1.0 pages  
xwiki-bridge - (10:11): [Vincent Massol] it would be indeed  
xwiki-bridge - (10:11): [Vincent Massol] but i don't even understand we'd want this  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:11): I meant to implement it so the admin could choose  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:11): cross site scripting  
xwiki-bridge - (10:11): [Vincent Massol] what's the logic?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:12): [Vincent Massol] how is that related to syntax 1.0?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:12): 1.0 doesn't filter script tags am I right?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:12): [Vincent Massol] script tags?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:12): [Vincent Massol] html?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:13): [Vincent Massol] 1.0 has the notion of renderers  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:13): yes html script tags <script language=javascript> ...  
xwiki-bridge - (10:13): [Vincent Massol] caleb: that's relatively easy to restrict in 1.0 too  
xwiki-bridge - (10:14): [Vincent Massol] I don't understand something  
xwiki-bridge - (10:14): [Vincent Massol] we support restricting the list of syntaxes  
xwiki-bridge - (10:14): [Vincent Massol] so if a user doesn't want 1.0 syntax we can just not list them in the allowed list of syntaxes  
xwiki-bridge - (10:14): [Vincent Massol] s/them/it/  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:15): You mean turning it off entirely.  
xwiki-bridge - (10:15): [Vincent Massol] it's turned off only for edit not for view  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:16): So an admin can edit pages in 1.0 then turn it off and the pages can't be touched?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:17): [Vincent Massol] not quite  
xwiki-bridge - (10:17): [Vincent Massol] actually maybe  
xwiki-bridge - (10:17): [Vincent Massol] I don'tknow what happens  
xwiki-bridge - (10:17): [Vincent Massol] if you have a page in 1.0  
xwiki-bridge - (10:17): [Vincent Massol] and try to edit it  
xwiki-bridge - (10:17): [Vincent Massol] I guess it'll be saved in 2.0 syntax  
xwiki-bridge - (10:17): [Vincent Massol] but I haven't tried it  
xwiki-bridge - (10:17): [Vincent Massol] maybe not actually  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:17): Where would I turn this off to test xwiki.cfg?  
xwiki-bridge - (10:17): [Vincent Massol] it's possible the 2.0 syntax will not be highlighted in edit mode  
xwiki-bridge - (10:18): [Vincent Massol] so a 1.0 page can probably be saved in 1.0  
xwiki-bridge - (10:18): [Vincent Massol] but that's a good behavior IMO  
xwiki-bridge - (10:18): [Vincent Massol] http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Configuration#HConfiguringWikiSyntaxesanddefaultSyntax  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:19): In response to the email question about security I put together a draft about security issues and the only glaring issues were script injection and groovy private methods.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:19): I just want to make sure it's accurate before posting.  
xwiki-bridge - (10:20): [Vincent Massol] ok great  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:26  
Lukemon joined #xwiki at 11:27  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:02): Is there any way to limit use of certain syntax 2.0 macros eg: html?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:03): To those with programming permission?  
xwiki-bridge - (12:05): [Vincent Massol] Caleb: see http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-3953  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:05): Thank you.  
xwiki-bridge - (12:42): [Vincent Massol] sdumitriu: I've changed strategy, I'm now making user inactive rather than delete them. ThomasM suggested this to me  
xwiki-bridge - (12:43): [Vincent Massol] I hope it works  
xwiki-bridge - (12:44): [sdumitriu] I'm not sure it helps  
xwiki-bridge - (12:46): [sdumitriu] Those users are created automatically  
xwiki-bridge - (12:46): [sdumitriu] And most of them don't do anything anyway  
xwiki-bridge - (12:46): [sdumitriu] They just pollute the database  
xwiki-bridge - (12:46): [sdumitriu] Deleting them keeps the database smaller  
xwiki-bridge - (12:47): [sdumitriu] Btw, we should update xwiki.org and make XWikiAllGroup purely virtual  
xwiki-bridge - (12:47): [sdumitriu] Right now it takes a lot to load and save  
xwiki-bridge - (12:47): [sdumitriu] I can see that because deleting a user takes almost a minute  
xwiki-bridge - (12:49): [sdumitriu] SecondGenerationWiki takes a lot of spam  
xwiki-bridge - (12:49): [sdumitriu] Should we disable editing for non-admins on it?  
xwiki-bridge - (13:01): [sdumitriu] aaronkolodjski should be disabled indeed, since it's a different kind of spam user  
xwiki-bridge - (13:01): [sdumitriu] I think it's a real person, so disabling might send a message  
xwiki-bridge - (13:02): [sdumitriu] Although I doubt it will come back  
xwiki-bridge - (13:14): [sdumitriu] Caleb, up so early  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:14): No, late :)  
lucaa left at 13:54 ("Leaving."  
xwiki-bridge - (18:59): [Vincent Massol] fyi I'm almost done with first part of my large xwiki-model refactoring.... still need a few hours to complete and then lots of migrator work + review all places creating reference....  
CalebJamesDeLisl left at 19:05 (  
xwiki-bridge - (20:47): [NielsMayer] regarding spam users, a good algorithm for autodeleting is any users with same first and last name, are created by a bot  
xwiki-bridge - (20:48): [sdumitriu] NielsMayer: Yep, that's what I'm doing  
xwiki-bridge - (20:48): [sdumitriu] firstname = lastname = username  
xwiki-bridge - (20:48): [sdumitriu] = some random name  
xwiki-bridge - (20:48): [NielsMayer] might be a good small change to make in the registration code. prevent it from happening in the first place  
xwiki-bridge - (20:49): [NielsMayer] and maybe have the person answer a simple math question.
